quoteLast: , six long-exposure, wide-angle photographs of the dark side of Jupiter had been scheduled to search for aurorae and lightning. The spacecraft was 1 450 000 kilometers from Jupiter and about two degrees below the equatorial plane.
title: Voyage to Jupiter
author: Morrison, David, 1940-; Samz, Jane

quoteFirst: From about 6.10 P.M. onwards they had come under fire of guns of heavy calibre from the enemy’s battle cruisers, but Sir Robert Arbuthnot, as gallant and determined an officer as ever lived, was evidently bent on finishing off his opponent, and held on, probably not realising in the gathering smoke and mist that the enemy’s heavy ships were at fairly close range. At about
quoteLast: the _Defence_ was hit by two salvoes in quick succession, which caused her magazines to blow up and the ship disappeared. The loss of so valuable an officer as Sir Robert Arbuthnot and so splendid a ship’s company as the officers and men of the _Defence_ was a heavy blow.
title: The Grand Fleet, 1914-1916
author: Jellicoe, John Rushworth, 1859-1935

quoteFirst: The accuracy of the “plot” is therefore confirmed, so far as confirmation is possible. It appears certain that between about 6.0 P.M. and
quoteLast: the German battle cruisers turned 16 points towards their Battle Fleet, and again turned 16 points to their original course. This is borne out by observations on board the _Warrior_, which ship was being engaged by the _starboard_ guns of enemy vessels.
title: The Grand Fleet, 1914-1916
author: Jellicoe, John Rushworth, 1859-1935

quoteFirst: He opened his eyes at times, and until within twenty minutes before his death he seemed to recognise me. At
quoteLast: , he rendered up his spirit into the arms of death in his sleep.
title: My Memoirs, Vol. VI, 1832 to 1833
author: Dumas, Alexandre, 1802-1870; Waller, E. M. (Emily Mary) [Translator]

quoteLast: ty,” said the old man with a sigh; “and I have nearly lost my sight and my hearing.”
title: Wild Wales: Its People, Language and Scenery
author: Borrow, George, 1803-1881

quoteLast: _Defence_ and _Warrior_ were observed passing down between the British and German Battle Fleets under a very heavy fire. _Defence_ disappeared, and _Warrior_ passed to rear disabled.

author: Reynolds, Francis J. (Francis Joseph), 1867-1937 [Editor]; Churchill, Allen L. (Allen Leon), 1873-1940 [Editor]
